Class StrategyBase.TradeManagerClass

Namespace
FinScript.Code
Assembly
FinScript.Core.dll

Trade manager for specified Instrument and Account

[PublicAPI]
public class StrategyBase.TradeManagerClass
Inheritance
object
StrategyBase.TradeManagerClass
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.MemberwiseClone()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)

Remarks

The main purpose of the trade manager is to provide a set of methods to manage positions and orders for the specified instrument and account. In most cases, a strategy logic works with the instrument and account assigned to the strategy. However, in some cases, it is necessary to work with a different instrument or account. Withing the strategy, you can use TradeManager to get the default trade manager. If you need custom trade manager, you can use CreateTradeManager(Account, Instrument)

ExitByMarket(string)

Generates an order(s) to exit current position(s). For netting accounts: generates only one order (short or long) to flatten current netting position. If current netting position is already flat, then return empty list For hedging positions: the method closes each position Only positions of the current instrument and strategy are considered, IsPositionAcceptable(Position, Func<Position, bool>), GetPositions(Func<Position, bool>?)

public IReadOnlyList<OrderOperationResult> ExitByMarket(string description = "Exit")

Parameters

description string

User defined signal name identifying the order generated. This value will be copied to Description

Returns

IReadOnlyList<OrderOperationResult>

A collection of submitted orders. If there is nothing to close, the collection is empty

ExitLongByMarket(Quantity, string?, TimeInForce)

Generates a sell market order to exit a long position. This method supports netting accounts only. Only positions of the current instrument and strategy are considered. IsPositionAcceptable(Position, Func<Position, bool>) GetPositions(Func<Position, bool>?)

public OrderOperationResult ExitLongByMarket(Quantity quantity, string? description = "Exit long", TimeInForce timeInForce = TimeInForce.Gtc)

GetNettingPosition()

Summarized position for Instrument and Account GetPositions(Func<Position, bool>?)

public AggregatedPosition GetNettingPosition()

Returns

AggregatedPosition

Remarks

This method calculated netting position on the fly, so be careful about calling it multiple times

GetNettingPositionQuantity()

Summarized position for Instrument and Account

public SignedQuantity GetNettingPositionQuantity()

Returns

SignedQuantity

Negative value for short result position, positive value for long result position and zero for flat position

Remarks

This method calculated netting position on the fly, so be careful about calling it multiple times This method is a bit faster than GetNettingPosition() because it calculates only result quantity, without price

GetPositions(Func<Position, bool>?)

Returns all positions of Account for instrument Instrument

public Position[] GetPositions(Func<Position, bool>? filterDelegate = null)

Parameters

filterDelegate Func<Position, bool>

Returns

Position[]

Remarks

For optimization purposes, consider using more specific methods, according to the task: GetFirstOrDefaultPosition(Func<Position, bool>?), AnyPositions(Func<Position, bool>?) etc Do not trade inside filterDelegate, it may lead to deadlock

GetPotentialMarketPosition()

Summarize current opened lots with current not filled market orders If result>0, then position will be Long. If result less than 0,then position will be short Otherwise the position wil be flat Examples:

  1. Position is flat, no market orders working. => Flat
  2. Position is short (lots=1), 1 long market order (lots=1) working =>Flat
  3. Position is long (lots=1), 1 short market order (lots=1) working =>Flat
  4. Position is long (lots=2), 1 short market order (lots=1) working =>Long
public MarketPosition GetPotentialMarketPosition()

Returns

MarketPosition

GetPotentialNettingPositionQuantity()

Summarize current opened lots with current not filled market orders If result>0, then position will be Long. If result less than 0,then position will be short Otherwise the position wil be flat Examples:

  1. Position is flat, no market orders working. => 0
  2. Position is short (lots=1), 1 long market order (lots=1) working =>0
  3. Position is long (lots=1), 1 short market order (lots=1) working =>0
  4. Position is long (lots=2), 1 short market order (lots=1) working =>1
  5. Position is long (lots=1), 1 short market order (lots=2) working =>-1
public SignedQuantity GetPotentialNettingPositionQuantity()

Returns

SignedQuantity

NormalizeQuantity(Quantity)

Checks if quantity is larger than minimal possible quantity and is aligned to minimal possible quantity If rounding is necessary it always rounds to higher value

public Quantity NormalizeQuantity(Quantity quantity)

Parameters

quantity Quantity

Returns

Quantity

Print(string) 

protected void Print(string text)

Parameters

text string

SelectFromPositions<T>(Func<Position, T>, Func<Position, bool>?)

Returns all positions of Account for instrument Instrument

public T[] SelectFromPositions<T>(Func<Position, T> selectDelegate, Func<Position, bool>? filterDelegate = null)

Parameters

selectDelegate Func<Position, T>
filterDelegate Func<Position, bool>

Returns

T[]

Type Parameters

T

Remarks

For optimization purposes, consider using more specific methods, according to the task: GetFirstOrDefaultPosition(Func<Position, bool>?), AnyPositions(Func<Position, bool>?) etc

SubmitOrder(OrderSubmissionParameters, OrderSubmissionContext?)

The basic method to send order to broker. It has a logic of preliminary checking the order and correcting its parameters if needed

public OrderOperationResult SubmitOrder(OrderSubmissionParameters parameters, OrderSubmissionContext? submissionContext = null)

Parameters

parameters OrderSubmissionParameters
submissionContext OrderSubmissionContext

Handlers to intercept different stages of order submission

Returns

OrderOperationResult

SubmitOrder(TradeAction, OrderType, Quantity, double, double, string?, string?, TimeInForce, double?, double?)

Submits an order with the specified parameters

public OrderOperationResult SubmitOrder(TradeAction tradeAction, OrderType orderType, Quantity quantity, double limitPrice, double stopPrice, string? oco, string? description, TimeInForce timeInForce, double? stopLoss = null, double? takeProfit = null)

Parameters

tradeAction TradeAction
orderType OrderType
quantity Quantity
limitPrice double
stopPrice double
oco string
description string

User defined signal name identifying the order generated. This value will be copied to Description

timeInForce TimeInForce

Value Gtd is not allowed. For GTD orders use another method SubmitOrder(TradeAction, OrderType, Quantity, double, double, string?, string?, DateTime, double?, double?)

stopLoss double?

Stop loss. Broker must support stop and limit orders, PositionStopLossTakeProfit

takeProfit double?

Take profit. Broker must support stop and limit orders,PositionStopLossTakeProfit

Returns

OrderOperationResult

Remarks

This method cannot submit good-till-date orders. For GTD orders use another method SubmitOrder(TradeAction, OrderType, Quantity, double, double, string?, string?, DateTime, double?, double?)

Exceptions

ArgumentException

Stop loss. Broker must support stop and limit orders, PositionStopLossTakeProfit

takeProfit double?

Take profit. Broker must support stop and limit orders,PositionStopLossTakeProfit

Returns

OrderOperationResult

SubmitSellStopLimitOrderAndWait(Quantity, double, double, string?, DateTime, double?, double?)

Generates a sell stop limit order (StopLimit) and waits for it get working state Working or be cancelled/rejected

public OrderOperationResult SubmitSellStopLimitOrderAndWait(Quantity quantity, double stopPrice, double limitPrice, string? signalName, DateTime goodTillDate, double? stopLoss = null, double? takeProfit = null)

TrailStopLoss(Position, double)

Checks if the current stop loss can be moved ahead to keep distance distance from the current price

public bool TrailStopLoss(Position position, double distance)

Parameters

position Position
distance double

A price delta

Returns

bool

true if stop loss of position was shifted
